intro: Neoporteria islayensis f. brevispina, commonly known as the Islay neoporteria, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to the Scottish isles. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green in color, and it produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathland and moorland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
